ENGINEERING TECHNICIAN
Professional Summary
Engineering Technician specializing in quality control sector.
Analytical thinker skilled collecting data and executing product testing procedures with precision and ease.
Results-driven and focused Engineering Technician successful at prioritizing safety, promoting cost-effective solutions and exceeding customer expectations.
Determined Maintenance Worker with skills performing routine operation checks on work equipment and always exercising safety measures to limit injuries.
Hardworking employee with over [2] years of carrying out oral and written instructions effectively and efficiently.
Uses constructive criticism to improve skills and job performance.
Safety-minded Maintenance Worker tasked with troubleshooting, general plumbing and minor electrical work.
Enthusiastic professional promoting excellent attendance record and willing to assist team members in completing assigned tasks.
Organized and dependable candidate successful at managing multiple priorities while maintaining a strong work ethic and exhibiting a positive attitude.
Willingness to take on added responsibilities to meet team goals.
Friendly student available for weekend, evening andholiday shifts.
Considered hardworking, punctual and driven.
To seek and maintain a full-time position that offers professional challenges utilizing interpersonal skills, excellent time management and problem-solving skills.
Dedicated Customer Service professional with knowledge of service delivery and proven multitasking abilities.
Committed to maintaining professional relationships to increase profitability and drive business results.
Customer Service Representative bringing top-notch skills in oral and written communication, active listening and analytical problem-solving skills.
Enhances customer experiences by employing service-oriented behaviors, understanding customer desires and providing customized solutions to build loyalty.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Maintenance Technician

Location: Concord, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Overview: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Industrial Maintenance Technician to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in mechanical and electrical systems, with the ability to diagnose and repair equipment in an industrial setting. The Industrial Maintenance Technician will play a critical role in ensuring the smooth operation of our facilities by performing preventive maintenance, troubleshooting equipment issues, and implementing corrective actions to minimize downtime.

Responsibilities

Perform routine and preventive maintenance on industrial equipment and machinery to ensure optimal performance and longevity.Troubleshoot mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic systems to identify and resolve issues efficiently.Repair or replace defective parts, components, or systems using hand and power tools, precision measuring instruments, and diagnostic equipment.Conduct inspections and tests to assess the condition of equipment and determine the need for maintenance or repairs.Follow safety protocols and guidelines to maintain a safe working environment for yourself and others.Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, including work orders, equipment manuals, and inventory of spare parts.Collaborate with other departments to coordinate maintenance activities and prioritize repairs based on production schedules.Assist in the installation, relocation, or modification of equipment as needed.Stay current with advancements in industrial technology and maintenance techniques through training and professional development opportunities.Support continuous improvement initiatives by proposing and implementing process enhancements to increase efficiency and reliability.

Requirements

High school diploma or equivalent; additional technical education or certification in industrial maintenance is preferred.Proven experience as an Industrial Maintenance Technician or similar role in a manufacturing or industrial environment.Proficiency in troubleshooting and repairing mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic systems.Strong knowledge of industrial machinery such as conveyors, motors, pumps, and compressors.Ability to read and interpret technical manuals, schematics, and blueprints.Proficient in the use of hand and power tools, welding equipment, and precision measuring instruments.Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Effective communication skills, both verbal and written.Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team.Willingness to work flexible hours, including nights and weekends, to respond to emergencies or support production schedules.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
